recipes.title: Flavorful German Pork Chops and Sauerkraut

winePairing.pairingText: Pork Chops works really well with Riesling, Chardonnay, and Pinot Noir. Chardonnay suits simple chops or chops in a butter or cream sauce, dry riesling complements sweet additions like honey mustard or apples, and pinot noir is a safe bet for pork dishes in general. You could try Poet's Leap Riesling. Reviewers quite like it with a 4 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Poet's Leap Riesling
productMatches.description: Key lime and fresh citrus peel aromas give way to vivid layers of white peach and stone fruit flavors accented by a pleasant touch of minerality. Delicious natural acidity and a hint of residual sugar provide a balanced, vibrant mouth-feel and lengthy finish.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C).                            Place bread crumbs into a shallow dish; pour eggs into a separate shallow dish. Heat vegetable shortening in a skillet over medium-high heat. Dip pork chops into egg, then into bread crumbs, coating both sides. Fry chops in the hot shortening until crumbs are golden brown, about 5 minutes per side. Transfer pork chops to a baking dish, leaving melted shortening in skillet.                            Cook and stir sauerkraut with juice, onion, and caraway seeds in the same skillet over medium-low heat until heated through, about 5 minutes. Spread sauerkraut over pork chops and pour pan liquid over the top. Cover baking dish tightly with aluminum foil.                            Bake in the preheated oven until chops are tender, 1 1/2 hour.                                                Kitchen-Friendly View

steps.step: Preheat oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C).
Place bread crumbs into a shallow dish; pour eggs into a separate shallow dish.

Heat vegetable shortening in a skillet over medium-high heat. Dip pork chops into egg, then into bread crumbs, coating both sides. Fry chops in the hot shortening until crumbs are golden brown, about 5 minutes per side.
Transfer pork chops to a baking dish, leaving melted shortening in skillet.
Cook and stir sauerkraut with juice, onion, and caraway seeds in the same skillet over medium-low heat until heated through, about 5 minutes.
Spread sauerkraut over pork chops and pour pan liquid over the top. Cover baking dish tightly with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until chops are tender, 1 1/2 hour.
